revised_title: Ancient Inscriptions and Etruscan Language Discoveries in Rome
tldr: The author, Octavian Pulleyn, shares his findings of two inscriptions discovered in Rome. One is in the Palmereni language, found on an old vine, and the other is in the Etruscan language, discovered on an old urn. He discusses the challenges of comparing and transcribing these inscriptions and mentions the publication of Pietro Sancta Bartoli's book on old Roman and Etruscan sepulchers.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
